readme:
This repository demonstrates a subtle error that can occur in Haskell when using the `sort` function from `Data.List`. The code compiles without warnings, but attempting to sort a list containing heterogeneous types will cause a runtime error.

The solution involves adding explicit type annotations to ensure that the list elements are comparable. The solution provides a corrected version with explicit type annotations and demonstrates how to handle potential errors when using the `sort` function with potentially heterogeneous lists.  This showcases the importance of type safety and careful handling of type constraints in Haskell.
